title.narrative: Collective Action Against Hunger and Poverty in Central Region

description.narrative: This project will help 1,350 families in the central region of Nepal out of poverty. Heifer International will provide 450 original project families with 900 goats and 22 bucks. Families will also receive the agricultural support of fodder and forage seeds, as well as saplings and vegetable seeds for kitchen gardening. An additional 900 families will benefit through Passing on the Gift. All project participants will be trained on fodder and forage production, gender justice, Heifer’s 12 Cornerstones, HIV/AIDS awareness, improved animal management, kitchen gardening and organic farming and self-help group management. To protect the environment, 100 families will be given improved cooking stoves and toilets. Heifer will train four participants as village animal health workers and will provide basic veterinary equipment and supplies. This project will also form youth groups in the project areas and provide Cornerstone training to increase the groups’ capacities. Through this project, participating communities will significantly improve their living conditions and eliminate barriers to social unity in order to make a healthier, more just and sustainable society. A powerful effect of the Cornerstones and other trainings is that the traditional discrimination between castes and against women falls away, and communities come together in harmony. Women rise to leadership positions, and communities learn how to work together effectively to bring themselves out of huger and poverty.
